translated: To the Tathāgatas Arhats Samyaksaṃbuddhas who are the foremost of all the worlds in the ten directions, who abide, who endure, who maintain themselves.
May those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, bring to mind.

original: yanmayā asyāṃ jātau anyāsu vā jātiṣu anavarāgre jātisaṃsāre saṃsaratā pāpakaṃ karma kṛtaṃ syātkāritaṃ vā kriyamāṇaṃ vā anumoditaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yat mayā asyām jātau anyāsu vā jātiṣu an avara agre jāti saṃsāre saṃsaratā pāpakam karma kṛtam syāt kāritam vā kriyamāṇam vā anumoditam bhavet
translated: Whatever evil deeds I have done in this birth or in other births, or caused to be done or consented to while wandering in beginningless cyclic existence.

original: staupikaṃ vā sāṃghikaṃ vā dravyamapahṛtaṃ syāt /
analyzed: staupikam vā sāṃghikam vā dravyam apahṛtam syāt
translated: Or whatever property belonging to the stūpa or the Saṃgha I may have stolen.

original: hāritaṃ vā hriyamāṇaṃ vā anumoditaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: hāritam vā hriyamāṇam vā anumoditam bhavet
translated: Or if it is stolen or being stolen, I rejoice in it.

original: pancānantaryāṇi kṛtāni syuḥ kāritāni vā kriyamāṇāni vā anumoditāni bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: panca ānantaryāṇi kṛtāni syuḥ kāritāni vā kriyamāṇāni vā anumoditāni bhaveyuḥ
translated: I may have committed, caused to be done, or rejoiced in the five heinous acts.

analyzed: daśa akuśalān karma pathān samādāya vartitam syāt
translated: I may have undertaken and practiced the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: pare vā samādāpitāḥ syurvartamānā vā anumoditā bhaveyuryena karmāvaraṇenāvṛto 'haṃ
analyzed: pare vā samādāpitāḥ syuḥ vartamānāḥ vā anumoditāḥ bhaveyuḥ yena karma āvaraṇena āvṛtaḥ haṃ
translated: Or I may have caused others to undertake them, or rejoiced in them being practiced. By whatever karmic obscuration I am covered,🔽I may go to hell, or to the animal realm, or to the realm of Yama.

original: nirayaṃ vā gaccheyaṃ tiryagyoniṃ vā yamaviṣayaṃ vā gaccheyaṃ pratyantajanapadeṣu
analyzed: nirayam vā gaccheyam tiryagyonim vā yama viṣayam vā gaccheyam pratyanta janapadeṣu
translated: I may be reborn among barbarians in the border regions,🔽or I may be reborn among the long-lived gods, or I may attain a deficient faculty,

original: mleccheṣu vā pratyājāyeyaṃ dīrghāyuṣkeṣu deveṣūpapadyeyamindriyavikalatāṃ vādhigaccheyaṃmithyādṛṣṭiṃ
analyzed: mleccheṣu vā pratyājāyeyam dīrgha āyuṣkeṣu deveṣu upapadyeyam indriya vikala tām vā adhigaccheyam mithyādṛṣṭim
translated: or I may adopt wrong views,

analyzed: vā upagṛhṇīyām buddha utpādam vā virāgayeyam
translated: or I may turn away from the appearance of a Buddha.

original: tatsarvaṃkarmāvaraṇaṃ teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jñānabhūtānāṃ cakṣurbhūtānāṃ sākṣibhūtānāṃ pramāṇabhūtānāṃ jānatāṃ paśyatamagrataḥ pratideśayāmi /
analyzed: tat sarvam karma āvaraṇam teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām jñāna bhūtānām cakṣuḥ bhūtānām sākṣi bhūtānām pramāṇa bhūtānām jānatām paśyatam agratas pratideśayāmi
translated: I confess in the presence of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are the essence of knowledge, the essence of vision, the essence of witnesses, the essence of authority, the knowers, the seers, all that karmic obscuration.
I reveal it, I do not conceal it.
I undertake restraint for the future.

original: samanvāharantu māṃ te buddhā bhagavanto yanmayā asyāṃ jātāvanyāsu vā jātiṣvanavarāgre vā jātisaṃsāre saṃsaratā dānaṃ dattaṃ bhavedantaśastiryagyonigatāyāpyālopaḥ /
analyzed: samanvāharantu mām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ yat mayā asyām jātau anyāsu vā jātiṣu an avara agre vā jāti saṃsāre saṃsaratā dānam dattam bhavet antaśas tiryagyoni gatāya api ālopaḥ
translated: May those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, consider me, in that I have given gifts in this life or in other lives, or in the beginningless cycle of existence, or even a morsel of food to an animal.

original: śīlaṃ vā rakṣitaṃ bhaved yacca me brahmacaryavāsakuśalamūlam /
analyzed: śīlam vā rakṣitam bhavet yat ca me brahmacarya vāsa kuśala mūlam
translated: Or I have observed morality, or whatever root of merit there is of mine from dwelling in celibacy,

analyzed: yat ca me sattva paripāka kuśala mūlam
translated: or whatever root of merit there is of mine from maturing beings,

analyzed: yat ca me bodhi citta kuśalam
translated: or whatever root of merit there is of mine from the thought of enlightenment,

original: yacca me 'nuttarajñānakuśalamūlam /🔽tatsarvamaikadhyaṃ piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā abhisaṃkṣipya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau uttarottarayā gurugurūṇā
analyzed: yat ca me nuttara jñāna kuśala mūlam  tat sarvam aikadhyam piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā abhisaṃkṣipya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau uttarottarayā guru gurūṇā
translated: or whatever root of merit there is of mine from the knowledge of unsurpassed enlightenment,
having combined, collected, and heaped them all together, I dedicate them to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, more and more, with the highest dedication.

analyzed: yathā pariṇāmitam atītaiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavabhdiḥ yathā pariṇāmayiṣyanti anāgatāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: As it has been dedicated by the Buddhas of the past, as it will be dedicated by the Buddhas of the future,

original: yathā pariṇāmayanti etarhi daśasu dikṣu pratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantaḥ tathā hamapi pariṇāmayāmi /
analyzed: yathā pariṇāmayanti etarhi daśasu dikṣu pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tathā ham api pariṇāmayāmi
translated: as it is being dedicated by the Buddhas of the present in the ten directions, so also I dedicate.
I confess all my evil deeds.
I rejoice in all merit.
I will request all the Buddhas.
May I attain unsurpassed knowledge.

original: ye cābhyatītāstathapi ca ye anāgatā ye cāpi tiṣṭhanti narottamā jināḥ /
analyzed: ye ca abhyatītāḥ ca ye anāgatāḥ ye ca api tiṣṭhanti nara uttamāḥ jināḥ
translated: Those who have passed beyond, and those who have not yet come, and those who abide, the supreme humans, the victorious ones,

analyzed: ananta varṇān guṇa sāgara upamān upaimi sarvān śaraṇam kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: I, with palms joined, go for refuge to all of them, who are like oceans of qualities, of infinite descriptions.
It is finished.

analyzed: ārya tri skandha mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: The noble Mahāyāna sūtra called the Three Aggregates is completed.
